item.title: Simple RSA Encryption with Mathematica
item.author: merturk
item.description: RSA is a widely used public-key algorithm that relies on a pair of keys â€” a public key (e) for encryption and a private key (d) for decryption. More information can be found on Wikipedia and Understanding Cryptography Textbook. For testing purposes and to explore how Mathematica handles RSA encryption, I would like to write a small script that encrypts and decrypts data using RSA with small numbers. You can download Mathamatica notebook and also sample output.
